#Text=In the August 2009 publication of " Freedom " , they slandered both the St. Petersburg Times reporters and the " defectors " ( myself , Marty Rathbun , Mike Rinder and Tom DeVocht ) .

column1: #Text=Note : they did not use the name " Amy Scobee " in this magazine .
#Text=Instead , they refer to me as " the Adulteress " .
#Text=This slanderous character assassination appears in more than 20 places in their publication .
#Text=It 's painfully obvious that they were referring to me since I was the only female that spoke out in the article they were protesting .
#Text=I 'm not " an adulteress " .
#Text=As a member of Scientology 's Sea Organization ( age 16 to 42 ) , I had sexual intercourse with my first husband , my second husband and my current husband .
#Text=Regardless , my " sexual purity " has nothing to do with my reporting

column1: #Text=the fact that I witnessed the head of the Church of Scientology commit repeated assault & battery on specific church executives while I was employed there .
#Text=It 's just their attempt to " annihilate credibility " for exposing this crime .

column1: #Text=In my view , the Freedom magazine is used to help carry out Miscavige 's private agenda to try to remain in a position of power in that organization .
#Text=Amy Scobee in 2009
#Text=Image : Amy Scobee .

#Text=BBC News reported on September 26 , that during an interview for the Panorama special , The Secrets of Scientology , yourself and reporter John Sweeney were photographed , and such photographs of the two of you hugging after completing the interview were sent by Scientology UK lawyers from the firm Carter-Ruck to the BBC .
#Text=What do you think Scientology was attempting to accomplish by sending these photos to the BBC ?
#Text=Is such behavior by the Scientology organization with regard to monitoring of journalists , critics , or former members such as yourself common ?
#Text=What do you do to cope and/or respond to such behavior from the Scientology organization ?
#Text=To me , it 's more important to prevent anyone else from being hurt by making Scientology 's human rights violations known — Amy Scobee
#Text=Yes , this type of intimidation is common practice by Scientology .
#Text=As a witness in an on-going court case against Scientology , I was recently in a deposition with Scientology 's lead counsel .

#Text=He pulled out the photo that their private investigators took of John Sweeney giving me a hug on the highway outside of the Scientology compound in Hemet after nearly two full days of interviews .

#Text=He proceeded to ask me how much " alone time " I spent with Mr. Sweeney ( which was none ) and when I explained that we all gave each other hugs goodbye before we went our separate ways and that my husband was right there with me , the lawyer said , " We 'll see what the jury says about that ! "

#Text=All they are trying to do is intimidate us into silence through constant trails by PI 's , slandering our names with ridiculous accusations , etc. , so we 'd become cowed , be quiet and let their criminality go on , unchecked .
#Text=Well , it has n't worked to keep me silent .

#Text=To me , it 's more important to prevent anyone else from being hurt by making Scientology 's human rights violations known than to worry about them tarnishing my personal reputation in retaliation .
#Text=I believe that the truth must be brought to light , despite consequences .
